newsitem.title: USA: Trism to take $4.1 mln charge for 1996.
newsitem.headline: Trism to take $4.1 mln charge for 1996.

text.p: TRISM Inc said Monday it will record a one-time pretax charge of about $4.1 million for the year ended December 31, 1996, to write down goodwill associated with the company's investment in its Trism Transport Services, Inc commercial flatbed trucking subsidiary.

After giving effect to the write-down, Trism said it expects to report a net loss in the range of $1.10 to $1.20 per share for 1996. The loss will be greater than previously expected primarily due to the writedown, it said.
It said its independent audit for 1996 has not yet been completed and further revisions to the expected results are possible.
Trism previously announced a plan to consolidate the management of its four business units into a single administrative operation, a plan intended to improve productivity and profitability.
It said the writedown it disclosed does not include reorganization, severance and other expenses related to the consolidation, which will be recorded during 1997.
Trism is a trucking company specializing in the transportation of heavy equipment and secured materials.
